header.#text:
Cooperative agreements under Sikes Act for land management related to Department of Defense
			 readiness activities

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Subsection (b) of section 103A of the Sikes Act

header.#text: Multiyear agreements to fund long-term management

text.#text: by adding at the end the following new paragraph:
In the case of a cooperative agreement under subsection (a)(2), funds referred to in paragraph (1)—

may be invested by the recipient in accordance with the recipient’s own guidelines for the
			 management and investment of financial assets, and any interest or income
			 derived from such investment may be applied for the same purposes as the
			 principal; and
may be used only for payment of—

direct costs of maintenance and improvement of natural resources on the lands within the scope of
			 the agreement and only pursuant to an approved Department of Defense
			 Integrated Natural Resource Management Plan; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, but not to exceed 10 percent of the total
			 cost of the project.

text.#text: indirect and administrative costs, as determined in accordance with official guidance issued by the
Subsection (c) of such section is amended to read as follows:

header.#text: Availability of funds and relation to other laws
Availability of funds and relation to other laws

text.#text:
Cooperative agreements and interagency agreements entered into under this section shall be subject
			 to the availability of funds.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
e, a cooperative agreement under this
			 section may be used to acquire property or services for the direct benefit
			 or use of the United States Government.

may not be used under this Act to acquire fee title
			 interest in real property for natural resources projects that are not on a
			 military installation.

shall conduct an audit of the natural resources
			 projects funded with amounts available to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Inspector General of the Department of Defense

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, as amended by this section, that is not on a military
			 installation. Not later than October 1, 2018, the

shall
			 submit to Congress a report on the audit conducted under this subsection.

text.#text:
This section and the provisions of law enacted by the amendments made by this section shall expire
			 on October 1, 2019, except that any cooperative agreement referred to in
			 such provisions that is entered into on or before September 30, 2019,
			 shall continue according to its terms and conditions as if this section
			 has not expired.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4309 RH: To amend the Sikes Act to make certain improvements to the administration of cooperative agreements for land management related to Department of Defense readiness activities, and for other purposes.
